structuretools module¶

class structuretools.structure(geometryfile)[source]¶

Bases: object

A base class for structure analysis and manipulation relying on the ASE.

Parameters

geometryfile (str) – Path to structure file (.cif, .xyz ..).

Variables

  • atoms (Atoms) – ASE atoms object.

  • atom_indices (dict) – Dictionary of atom index and label.

  • species (dict) – Dictionary of atom labels and counts.

  • fragments (dict) – Dictionary of (index: (original_index, atoms)) pairs.

  • attributes (dict) – Collection of attributes.

calculate_interlayer_distances(fragment1, fragment2)[source]¶

A specialised method for 2D layered systems to determine the interlayer distance and interstitial distance.

The average layer distance is defined as the difference between the average z-components of two fragments:

\[d_{int} = \sum_i^{N_1} z_i /{N_1} - \sum_j^{N_2} z_j / {N_2}\]

The interstitial distance is defined as the difference between the z-components of the two closest atoms of two fragments:

\[d_{isd} = min( z_1, z_2, ..., z_{N_1}) - max( z_1, z_2, ..., z_{N_2})\]

Note

This method also works for non-planar (curved) systems or interdented systems by calculating average distances of bonded fragments. The results do not have to make sense though.

enforce_2d()[source]¶

Enforces a 2D system by setting all z-components of the lattice basis to zero and puts an orthogonal c-axis of 100 Angström.

find_fragments()[source]¶

Finds unconnected structural fragments by constructing the first-neighbor topology matrix and the resulting graph of connected vortices.

Note

Requires networkx library.

standardize()[source]¶

Standardizes to the conventional unit cell employing the space group library.
